8_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh.body:
> [testset](#comment_31_17VwZEfWSUWb5RHkK9m1odnDdBfvjTL6Cp): Yes, Diaspora* is also a social network, but

    it respects your freedom and privacy
    it does not spies on you
    it does not poisons your mind with ads


https://wiki.diasporafoundation.org/FAQ_for_users#How_much_of_my_information_can_my_pod_administrator_see.3F 

//Privacy//Spying// -  Bad in a number of ways and definitely not privacy-friendly,because digital privacy only works if we use encryption and use it intelligently.Since the data is stored unencrypted,there is not even a hint of privacy.

##
PS: The "delete account and remove all data" option doesn't improve the situation,as the admin *can* (not saying all pod admins are bad/malicious.But unencrypted data invites abusive behaviour,unfortunately.) mirror all the unencrypted data without the users knowledge,thus retaining a copy of the data,rendering that functionality logically useless.
##

https://wiki.diasporafoundation.org/FAQ_for_pod_maintainers#Can_I_add_advertisements_to_my_pod.3F 

//Ads// - Although ads seem to not be displayed/implemented on pods by default,I think it's worth noting that the Diaspora Foundation has no rules against the implementation of ads.
